settings.autoConfigWarning1: If this option is not selected you will have to manually setup the Button+ using it's web interface.
settings.autoConfigWarning2: Warning: With this option on, the app will overwrite the existing button+ configuration.
settings.buttonExplanation:
Button Configrations can be applied to one or more Button+ button bars to determine what is displayed.
The button bar is a panel, with 2 small displays and 2 buttons, that can be used to control On/Off and Dim type devices or run flows.
The Configurations can be applied to button bars using the Apps Panel device or by Flows
settings.displayExplanation:
Display Configrations can be applied to one or more large Button+ displays to determine what is displayed.
You define the X and Y position of the top left corner of the item and it's width all as a percentage of the display width.
You can define multiple items to display but make sure they all fit.
settings.brokerExplanation:
You can define multiple brokers to connect to. Each broker can have multiple devices and each device can have multiple capabilities.
Each broker can be enabled or disabled. If disabled it will not be used to connect to the broker.
settings.topLabelExplanation: The Top Label is shown along the top of the small display. It can be used to show the name of the device or flow that is controlled by the button.
settings.label: Label
settings.deviceExplanation:
Select the device to control when you press the Button+ button.
Only devices with On/Off or Dim capabilities will be shown.
If you select none, then the nothing is directly controlled but you will still get the button pressed Flow trigger
settings.dimError: Dim __leftRight__ Change must be between ±1 and ±100. Please correct and try again.
settings.brokerIdExplanation: Select the Broker ID that you wan to send and receive messages from.
settings.address: Address (IP or URL) of the broker
settings.id: Broker ID (to identify the broker and must be unique)
settings.brokerHomey: This is the apps own broker. It can not be deleted but can be disabled if you don't want to use it.
settings.brokerButtonPlus: This is the Button+ broker. It can not be deleted but can be disabled if you don't want to use it.
settings.brokerUser: This is a user defined broker. It can be deleted or disabled.
